image.altText: Two Indigenous women smile at the camera in a composite image that includes a black and white photo and red desert.

props.synopsis: It has been more than 40 years since the Pintupi Nine made contact with the modern world. Much has changed in their lives, but their country has never stopped calling them home.

title.children: For years, these sisters didn't know white people existed

image.altText: An Aboriginal young woman, with black hair and a red stripe, holding a paint brush while dying someone's hair.

props.synopsis: Whether it's a fade, mullet or colours, a mobile salon set up in a shipping container out bush is giving Indigenous students access to haircuts and the opportunity to learn the trade.

title.children: 'People are thrilled': New remote salon ends hours-long trip for a cut

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy speaking into a microphone in front of a crowd and looking emotional.

props.synopsis: Michael Murphy had planned to deliver a second apology to Aboriginal people in the remote Northern Territory. But after his sudden departure, there’s no certainty it will happen.

title.children: Unfinished business: NT top cop's departure leaves second apology unsaid

image.altText: Justice Blokland in robes on the bench

props.synopsis: Presiding over the worst categories of offending in the NT Supreme Court, Judge Jenny Blokland is afforded a unique view of how justice is served. Her estimates are sobering.

title.children: Judge urges radical rethink of NT's 'wicked problem'

image.altText: man covers his head with a jumper to ward off the sun

props.synopsis: A new study by Australian researchers finds that the risk of cardiovascular disease increases with higher temperatures, and the burden could double by 2050 if extreme heat continues.

title.children: Heart disease set to soar in Australia as temperatures rise, study suggests

image.altText: A smiling older woman wearing spectacles poses for a family photo.

props.synopsis: About a dozen residents are locked in a bitter dispute with the operator of a retirement village on the West Australian coast. Lawyers say the situation is a sign of a deeply under-regulated system.

title.children: Family in legal dispute with retirement village that signed 92yo woman up to 'lease-for-life'

image.altText: A man wearing a red cap smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A former youth pastor from a mega church in Adelaide's northern suburbs has been arrested in the United States on charges of possessing child sexual abuse material.

title.children: Former Adelaide pastor arrested in US over alleged child abuse material

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit, red and black tie and white shirt and is speaking to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: As the early days of Donald Trump's second presidency up-ends established norms, Europe is contemplating what it might mean for their defence and nuclear arsenals.

title.children: France and the UK have nuclear weapons. One needs the US to use them

image.altText: A shot from in the air that shows the thousands and thousands of protesters gathered in Serbia's capital city at night

props.synopsis: Serbian officials have denied the country’s security forces used a long range acoustic device to disperse and scare protesters.

title.children: Serbia denies using sonic device as footage shows protesters fleeing

image.altText: Four Houthis holding up rifles and wearing scarves around their heads.

props.synopsis: The US has launched its biggest military operation in the Middle East against Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthis since Donald Trump took office. How did we get here?

title.children: Why is the US attacking Yemen's Houthis?

image.altText: People travelling along floodwaters in a small tinny boat.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has reviewed Queensland's flood maps, emergency zones, changes to town planning, and property records to examine how natural disasters are impacting the housing crisis.

title.children: 'Never should've let anyone build here': Qld government developed flood plain

image.altText: Flowers on a metal fence with the ocean ion the background.

props.synopsis: The body of a missing six-year-old girl has been found in bushland near a lookout at Nowra, on the NSW south coast.

title.children: Community in mourning as search for missing 6yo girl ends in heartbreak

image.altText: A man holds a statue head.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the apparent appearance of the missing head from a statue of King George V at a concert by Northern Irish rappers Kneecap in Melbourne.

title.children: Stolen statue head of King George V appears at Kneecap gig in Melbourne

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX closes 0.8 per cent higher following bargain hunters fuelling a partial recovery on Wall Street on Friday. See how the day unfolded on our live blog.

title.children: ASX rebounds after Wall Street's big bounce — as it happened

image.altText: Sam Mitchell, Isaac Kako and Harley Reid

props.synopsis: Coaches showed off some tricks from their playbook while the AFL showed it is in good hands with the next generation, even with Harley Reid showing his age in a moment he'd like to forget. Here are your quick hits from round one.

title.children: Quick hits: Coaching masterstrokes, starring rookies and an ugly Harley Reid act

image.altText: A group of men with their heads down sitting on the ground.

props.synopsis: At least 238 alleged members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua are deported and sent to El Salvador.

title.children: More than 200 alleged members of Venezuelan gang deported by Trump administration

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Roger Cook stands with the three Labor MPs chosen for the party's front bench.

props.synopsis: WA Labor's thumping election win left the party with plenty of choices for promotions to the state government's inner sanctum, with three MPs added to cabinet.

title.children: WA Labor selects three new cabinet members, after thumping election win

image.altText: A concrete sign that reads "Campbell Primary School.

props.synopsis: A court battle between the former head of the ACT's education directorate and the ACT's corruption watchdog ends with the ACT Supreme Court ordering no costs for either side.

title.children: No costs awarded in former education boss's legal battle with corruption watchdog

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man who pleaded guilty to trafficking drugs denies he had anything to do with the importation of a parcel containing methamphetamines, mailed from California to an address in the ACT.

title.children: Canberra man guilty of drug trafficking denies US importation involvement

image.altText: A portrait photo of Mayada. She's wearing a flower on her right ear. Has long black hair. There's long grasses behind her.

props.synopsis: Forced into sexual slavery at age 11, Mayada was sold seven times before she escaped ISIS. There are still 2,600 other women and girls missing in captivity today and their families want justice.

title.children: Once used as child sex slaves by ISIS, women are still seeking justice

image.altText: A photo of a scorched sign on a building reading 'pulse'.

props.synopsis: At least 59 died and 155 were injured after a fire broke out during a concert in North Macedonia's Pulse nightclub. Authorities say the club's licence was issued illegally and there was only one fire exit.

title.children: Barred windows, one fire exit: Why North Macedonian club fire was so deadly

image.altText: Flood water covering the majority of a young pecan nut plantation.

props.synopsis: Horticulture businesses were some of the hardest hit with strong winds causing widespread damage in orchards.

title.children: Ex-cyclone's 'sting in tail' causes $17m damage for NSW farmers

image.altText: A black and white photo of Cold Chisel on stage at the Uni Bar in Hobart

props.synopsis: Long-running Hobart music venue Uni Bar will close in June to make way for the University of Tasmania's STEM facility redevelopment. Its owner says it is a "significant blow" to the city's live-music scene.

title.children: Cold Chisel once graced its stage, now this Hobart venue is calling last drinks

image.altText: An architect's drawing shows a modern red building

props.synopsis: The first museum in Australia dedicated to the Vietnamese refugee experience will be built in Melbourne's western suburbs.

title.children: Australian-first Vietnamese museum breaks ground

image.altText: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister says the nation’s security cabinet will vote to dismiss the top spy, after an extraordinary breakdown between the pair.

title.children: Netanyahu moves to sack intelligence chief after accusing him of 'blackmail'

image.altText: Millie Bobby Browne with long blonde hair looks frightened, a creepy robot behind her shoulder

props.synopsis: The brothers behind some of the most successful Avengers movies have taken on the adaptation of a Swedish dystopian graphic novel, spending more than $US300 million in the process.

title.children: Netflix spent $500m on this film yet couldn't afford a decent wig

image.altText: A submarine rising up from the water

props.synopsis: Australians are being assured they will receive the "most advanced warship in the world" under the AUKUS partnership as doubts grow over the nuclear submarine deal.

title.children: US nuclear submarine commander urges Australians to back AUKUS

image.altText: Sonya holds a coffee cup

props.synopsis: A trans woman visiting from the Philippines says she had intimate photos searched through on her phone by authorities at Sydney International Airport, before being detained at Villawood Immigration Detention Centre.

title.children: Trans woman told she would be taken to hotel ended up in detention centre

image.altText: A large build up on cloud like foam on a beach.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway into fish deaths and a mysterious foam on a South Australian beach, with several people reportedly falling ill after visiting the area. The beach has now been closed by authorities.

title.children: Beach closed amid mysterious foam and dead fish along shoreline

image.altText: a man in a tshirt starting at camera

props.synopsis: A long-running scheme that pays workers' missing wages and annual leave when their employers collapse is being reviewed after claims it is being rorted. It's leading to additional calls to expand the policy.

title.children: A tradie and burger chef had very different workers compensation treatment

image.altText: A website reads 'This is the beginning of the journey to your dreams'.

props.synopsis: The liquidator for GrowPro Experience says more than 1,100 international students intending to study in Australia have been left out of the pocket by the agency's collapse.

title.children: Questions over funds sent out of Australia amid student agency's collapse

image.altText: Two plates of grilled chicken served on flatbread with yoghurt sauce and vegetables, a satisfying family dinner recipe.

props.synopsis: Healthy dinners can still be quick and delicious. Choose between beef taco bowls, grilled chicken wraps and a veggie and cheese-filled frittata.

title.children: Four easy dinners with ingredients from the five food groups
